span.b: DeKalb Independent School District is committed to providing ongoing educational opportunities for all students amid the COVID-19 virus school closure. Below you will find campus

instructions on how to access our online curriculum, pick up, and submit assignments. Directions for Food and Nutrtion Services as well as links to a variety of online learning tools are also posted. These are live documents that will be updated throughout this closure.

hr.p: Depending on the grade level and availability of internet and resources, students have the option of completely paper assignments or online assignments.
Online materials are currently being pushed out and will continue to be uploaded throughout the week.
Paper instructional materials will be ready for pick up by noon on Thursday until 3:00 p.m. on all campuses. Friday pickup times will be 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. on all campuses.

If possible, call ahead of time when coming to pick up assignments. To prevent any spread of sickness, office staff will prepare the packet for you and an employee will meet you outside with the assignments.
If you have any questions or concerns, please contact the campus office.

Campus Phone Numbers:
Elementary - 903-667-2328
Middle - 903-667-2834
High - 903-667-2422
**If you need technical assistance, feel free to message DeKalb ISD on facebook, or also email any of the following people for help:
DISD will continue to provide meals to our students during these unprecedented times. Thanks to all those who make this a reality and for the ongoing care and concern for our students and community.
👉Meals can be picked up starting Tuesday, March 24th behind the DeKalb Middle School cafeteria from 10-11 am.
👉Please stay in your vehicle and a staff member will find out how many meals you need and bring them to you.
👉Lunch will be served and breakfast for the following day will be included.
Please contact the campus offices if you have any questions or concerns

DeKalb ISD
101 Maple St., Dekalb TX 75559

div.div: DeKalb Independent School District does not discriminate on the basis of sex, ethnicity, race, color, age, or national origin in its educational programs or employment as required by Title IX, Section 504, and Title VI. Contact the webmaster of this site with any comments: Webmaster
